author: evandrix
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell
$(Get-Item *).PSExtended | Get-Member
```

Expected behavior
-----------------
The following output is produced:
```none
   TypeName: System.Management.Automation.PSMemberSet

Name  MemberType    Definition
----  ----------    ----------
Count AliasProperty Count = Length
```
For Environment:
```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      5.1.17134.1
PSEdition                      Desktop
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
BuildVersion                   10.0.17134.1
CLRVersion                     4.0.30319.42000
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
```

Actual behavior
---------------
No output is produced
```none

```

Environment data
----------------

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.1.0-preview.2
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.1.0-preview.2
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.17134
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: mklement0
comments.body:
Add the `-Force` switch:

    (Get-Item *).PSExtended | Get-Member -Force 

`Get-Member` doesn't display _hidden_ members by default, and `.psextended` is a hidden member.

As an aside: it is sufficient to use `(...)` to use a _single_ command as part of an expression (no need for `$(...)`).

comments.author: evandrix
comments.body:
mmm...thanks for the tip re: not needing the extra `$`, but with `-Force`, the `AliasProperty` `Count` is still missing, i.e.
_PowerShell 5.1_ (default shipped with Windows 10)

```powershell
PS > (Get-Item *).PSExtended | Get-Member -Force

   TypeName: System.Management.Automation.PSMemberSet

Name        MemberType    Definition
----        ----------    ----------
Count       AliasProperty Count = Length
pstypenames CodeProperty  System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection`1[[System.String, mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089]] pstypenames{get=PSTypeNames;}
psadapted   MemberSet     psadapted {Count}
psbase      MemberSet     psbase {InheritMembers, Members, Properties, Methods, MemberType, Value, TypeNameOfValue, Name, IsInstance, ToString, get_InheritMembers, get_Members, get_Properties, get_Methods, Copy, get_MemberType, get_V...
psextended  MemberSet     psextended {}
psobject    MemberSet     psobject {Members, Properties, Methods, ImmediateBaseObject, BaseObject, TypeNames, get_Members, get_Properties, get_Methods, get_ImmediateBaseObject, get_BaseObject, get_TypeNames, ToString, Copy, CompareTo...
```

_PowerShell 6_ (this repo)
```powershell
PS > (Get-Item *).PSExtended | Get-Member -Force

   TypeName: System.Management.Automation.PSMemberSet

Name        MemberType   Definition
----        ----------   ----------
pstypenames CodeProperty System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection`1[[System.String, System.Private.CoreLib, Version=4.0.0.0, Cultu...
psadapted   MemberSet    psadapted {}
psbase      MemberSet    psbase {InheritMembers, Members, Properties, Methods, MemberType, Value, TypeNameOfValue, Name, IsInstance...
psextended  MemberSet    psextended {}
psobject    MemberSet    psobject {Members, Properties, Methods, ImmediateBaseObject, BaseObject, TypeNames, get_Members, get_Prope...
```

comments.author: mklement0
comments.body: That's a different issue: The ETS `.Count` alias property (which surfaces an array's `.Length` property as `.Count` too) was removed in PowerShell Core, because it has been obsolete since PSv3, when _all_ objects implicitly gained a `.Count` property - see #3222

title: `.PSExtended` missing
